  • Problem (pyrit.problem)
  • View page source

Problem (pyrit.problem)

This module is responsible for managing problems.

Predefined Problem/Solution Types

Pyrit offers classes for electromagnetic and heat transfer problems of any time dependence. This allows to solve field problems based on a template-based workflow. Here, each supported problem type is listed and associated with the partial differential equation that governs the problem.

This package collects classes that represent standard problem formulations. They provide a framework for organizing all the data needed for defining a problem. Furthermore, they implement a solve method that provides a convenient way to solve a problem and returns a solution object (see the solution). Per problem type, i.e. the underlying differential equation, there are separate classes for static, harmonic and transient problems.

Pyrit supports magnetic, electric, current flow, and thermal modules of problem solution counterparts. Note that the modules ElectricProblemCart and ElectricProblemAxi solve the Poisson equation and, therefore, only provide static classes. Electroquasistatic scenarios can be simulated with modules CurrentFlowProblemCart and CurrentFlowProblemAxi.

Each problem can be computed for static, harmonic, and transient scenarios.

For the underlying FE discretization ansatz, it is important to distinguish Cartesian or axisymmetric cases. Therefore, for each case, i.e. Cartesian case (\(u(x,y)\)), denoted as ProblemCart and axisymmetric case (\(u(r,z)\)) denoted as ProblemAxi, a respective problem and solution pair exists.

The problem classes can be categorized into Electric problems, Magnetic problems, Thermal problems and Current flow problems. Furthermore there are General problem classes.

Electric problems

ElectricProblemCartStatic(description, ...)

A two-dimensional, electrostatic problem in Cartesian coordinates:

ElectricProblemAxiStatic(description, mesh, ...)

An electrostatic problem in axisymmetric coordinates:

Magnetic problems

MagneticProblemCartStatic(description, ...)

A static, two-dimensional magnetic problem in Cartesian coordinates.

MagneticProblemCartHarmonic(description, ...)

A harmonic, magnetic problem in two-dimensional Cartesian coordinates.

MagneticProblemCartTransient(description, ...)

A Transient, magnetic problem in two-dimensional Cartesian coordinates.

MagneticProblemAxiStatic(description, ...)

A static, two-dimensional magnetic problem in axisymmetric coordinates.

MagneticProblemAxiHarmonic(description, ...)

A harmonic, magnetic problem in two-dimensional axisymmetric coordinates.

MagneticProblemAxiTransient(description, ...)

A Transient, magnetic problem in two-dimensional axisymmetric coordinates.

Thermal problems

ThermalProblemCartStatic(description, mesh, ...)

A two-dimensional stationary heat conduction problem in Cartesian coordinates:

ThermalProblemCartHarmonic(description, ...)

A two-dimensional harmonic heat conduction problem in Cartesian coordinates:

ThermalProblemCartTransient(description, ...)

A two-dimensional transient heat conduction problem in Cartesian coordinates:

ThermalProblemAxiStatic(description, ...[, ...])

A stationary heat conduction problem in axisymmetric coordinates:

ThermalProblemAxiHarmonic(description, mesh, ...)

A harmonic heat conduction problem in axisymmetric coordinates:

ThermalProblemAxiTransient(description, ...)

A transient heat conduction problem in axisymmetric coordinates:

ThermalSolverInfoAxiStatic([...])

Class for passing options to the solve-method of ThermalProblemAxiStatic

ThermalSolverInfoAxiTransient([...])

Class for passing options to the solve-method of ThermalProblemAxiTransient

Current flow problems

CurrentFlowSolverInfoAxiStatic([...])

Class for passing options to the solve-method of CurrentFlowProblemAxiStatic

CurrentFlowSolverInfoAxiTransient([...])

Class for passing options to the solve-method of CurrentFlowProblemAxiTransient

CurrentFlowProblemCartStatic(description, ...)

A two-dimensional stationary current problem in Cartesian coordinates:

CurrentFlowProblemCartHarmonic(description, ...)

A two-dimensional harmonic electroquasistatic problem in Cartesian coordinates:

CurrentFlowProblemCartTransient(description, ...)

A two-dimensional transient electroquasistatic problem in Cartesian coordinates:

CurrentFlowProblemAxiStatic(description, ...)

A stationary current problem in axisymmetric coordinates:

CurrentFlowProblemAxiHarmonic(description, ...)

A harmonic electroquasistatic problem in axisymmetric coordinates:

CurrentFlowProblemAxiTransient(description, ...)

A transient electroquasistatic problem in axisymmetric coordinates:

General problem classes

Problem(description, mesh, shape_function, ...)

General representation of a problem.

StaticProblem(description, mesh, ...)

A general, static problem.

HarmonicProblem(description, mesh, ...)

A general, harmonic problem.

TransientProblem(description, mesh, ...)

A general, transient problem.
